_10.description: Sets the colors and styles for comments

_11.description: Sets the colors and styles for strings literals.

_12.description: Sets the colors and styles for keywords.

_13.description: Sets the colors and styles for number literals.

_14.description: Sets the colors and styles for type declarations and references.

_15.description: Sets the colors and styles for functions declarations and references.

_16.description: Sets the colors and styles for variables declarations and references.

_17.description: Sets colors and styles using textmate theming rules (advanced).

_18.description: Whether semantic highlighting should be enabled for this theme.

_20.description: Whether semantic highlighting is enabled or disabled for this theme

_21.description: Semantic token styling rules for this theme.

_23.markdownDescription: Controls whether suggestions should be accepted on commit characters. For example, in JavaScript, the semi-colon (`;`) can be a commit character that accepts a suggestion and types that character.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Only accept a suggestion with `Enter` when it makes a textual change.
_24.markdownDescription: Controls whether suggestions should be accepted on `Enter`, in addition to `Tab`. Helps to avoid ambiguity between inserting new lines or accepting suggestions.

enumDescriptions: Use platform APIs to detect when a Screen Reader is attached.
Optimize for usage with a Screen Reader.
Assume a screen reader is not attached.
_25.description: Controls if the UI should run in a mode where it is optimized for screen readers.

_26.description: Controls the number of lines in the editor that can be read out by a screen reader at once. When we detect a screen reader we automatically set the default to be 500. Warning: this has a performance implication for numbers larger than the default.

_27.description: Controls whether to allow using variable line heights in the editor.

_28.description: Controls whether to allow using variable fonts in the editor.

_29.description: Controls whether to allow using variable fonts in the editor in the accessibility mode.

enumDescriptions: Use language configurations to determine when to autoclose brackets.
Autoclose brackets only when the cursor is to the left of whitespace.
_30.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically close brackets after the user adds an opening bracket.

enumDescriptions: Use language configurations to determine when to autoclose comments.
Autoclose comments only when the cursor is to the left of whitespace.
_31.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically close comments after the user adds an opening comment.

_32.description: Control whether inline suggestions are announced by a screen reader.

enumDescriptions: Remove adjacent closing quotes or brackets only if they were automatically inserted.
_33.description: Controls whether the editor should remove adjacent closing quotes or brackets when deleting.

enumDescriptions: Type over closing quotes or brackets only if they were automatically inserted.
_34.description: Controls whether the editor should type over closing quotes or brackets.

enumDescriptions: Use language configurations to determine when to autoclose quotes.
Autoclose quotes only when the cursor is to the left of whitespace.
_35.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically close quotes after the user adds an opening quote.

enumDescriptions: The editor will not insert indentation automatically.
The editor will keep the current line's indentation.
The editor will keep the current line's indentation and honor language defined brackets.
The editor will keep the current line's indentation, honor language defined brackets and invoke special onEnterRules defined by languages.
The editor will keep the current line's indentation, honor language defined brackets, invoke special onEnterRules defined by languages, and honor indentationRules defined by languages.
_36.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically adjust the indentation when users type, paste, move or indent lines.

_37.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically auto-indent the pasted content.

_38.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically auto-indent the pasted content when pasted within a string. This takes effect when autoIndentOnPaste is true.

enumDescriptions: Use language configurations to determine when to automatically surround selections.
Surround with quotes but not brackets.
Surround with brackets but not quotes.
_39.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically surround selections when typing quotes or brackets.

_40.markdownDescription: Controls whether bracket pair colorization is enabled or not. Use `#workbench.colorCustomizations#` to override the bracket highlight colors.

_41.description: Controls whether each bracket type has its own independent color pool.

enumDescriptions: Enables bracket pair guides.
Enables bracket pair guides only for the active bracket pair.
Disables bracket pair guides.
_42.description: Controls whether bracket pair guides are enabled or not.

enumDescriptions: Enables horizontal guides as addition to vertical bracket pair guides.
Enables horizontal guides only for the active bracket pair.
Disables horizontal bracket pair guides.
_43.description: Controls whether horizontal bracket pair guides are enabled or not.

_44.description: Controls whether the editor should highlight the active bracket pair.

_45.description: Controls whether the editor should render indent guides.

enumDescriptions: Highlights the active indent guide.
Highlights the active indent guide even if bracket guides are highlighted.
Do not highlight the active indent guide.
_46.description: Controls whether the editor should highlight the active indent guide.

_47.description: Controls whether the editor shows CodeLens.

_48.description: Controls the font family for CodeLens.

_49.markdownDescription: Controls the font size in pixels for CodeLens. When set to 0, 90% of `#editor.fontSize#` is used.

_50.description: Controls whether the editor should render the inline color decorators and color picker.

_51.markdownDescription: Controls the max number of color decorators that can be rendered in an editor at once.

_52.description: Enable that the selection with the mouse and keys is doing column selection.

_53.description: Controls whether a space character is inserted when commenting.

_54.description: Controls if empty lines should be ignored with toggle, add or remove actions for line comments.

_55.description: Controls whether syntax highlighting should be copied into the clipboard.

enumDescriptions: Smooth caret animation is disabled.
Smooth caret animation is enabled only when the user moves the cursor with an explicit gesture.
Smooth caret animation is always enabled.
_57.description: Controls whether the smooth caret animation should be enabled.

_58.description: Controls the cursor style in insert input mode.

_59.description: Controls the minimal number of visible leading lines (minimum 0) and trailing lines (minimum 1) surrounding the cursor. Known as 'scrollOff' or 'scrollOffset' in some other editors.

enumDescriptions: `cursorSurroundingLines` is enforced only when triggered via the keyboard or API.
`cursorSurroundingLines` is enforced always.

_61.markdownDescription: Controls the width of the cursor when `#editor.cursorStyle#` is set to `line`.

_62.markdownDescription: Controls the height of the cursor when `#editor.cursorStyle#` is set to `line`. Cursor's max height depends on line height.

_63.description: Controls whether the editor should allow moving selections via drag and drop.

_64.markdownDescription: Controls whether you can drag and drop a file into a text editor by holding down the `Shift` key (instead of opening the file in an editor).

_65.markdownDescription: Controls if a widget is shown when dropping files into the editor. This widget lets you control how the file is dropped.
enumDescriptions: Show the drop selector widget after a file is dropped into the editor.
Never show the drop selector widget. Instead the default drop provider is always used.

_66.description: Sets whether the EditContext API should be used instead of the text area to power input in the editor.

_67.description: Controls whether copying without a selection copies the current line.

enumDescriptions: Use regular DOM-based rendering.
Use GPU acceleration.
_68.description: Controls whether to use the experimental GPU acceleration to render the editor.

enumDescriptions: Use a new rendering method with svgs.
Use a new rendering method with font characters.
Use the stable rendering method.
_69.description: Controls whether whitespace is rendered with a new, experimental method.

_71.description: Controls whether the cursor should jump to find matches while typing.

enumDescriptions: Never seed search string from the editor selection.
Always seed search string from the editor selection, including word at cursor position.
Only seed search string from the editor selection.
_72.description: Controls whether the search string in the Find Widget is seeded from the editor selection.

enumDescriptions: Never turn on Find in Selection automatically (default).
Always turn on Find in Selection automatically.
Turn on Find in Selection automatically when multiple lines of content are selected.
_73.description: Controls the condition for turning on Find in Selection automatically.

_74.description: Controls whether the Find Widget should add extra lines on top of the editor. When true, you can scroll beyond the first line when the Find Widget is visible.

_75.description: Controls whether the search automatically restarts from the beginning (or the end) when no further matches can be found.

enumDescriptions: Do not store search history from the find widget.
Store search history across the active workspace
_76.description: Controls how the find widget history should be stored

enumDescriptions: Do not store history from the replace widget.
Store replace history across the active workspace
_77.description: Controls how the replace widget history should be stored

_78.description: Controls whether the Find Widget should search as you type.

_79.description: Controls whether the editor has code folding enabled.

enumDescriptions: Use a language-specific folding strategy if available, else the indentation-based one.
Use the indentation-based folding strategy.
_80.description: Controls the strategy for computing folding ranges.

_81.description: Controls whether the editor should highlight folded ranges.

_82.description: Controls whether the editor automatically collapses import ranges.

_83.description: The maximum number of foldable regions. Increasing this value may result in the editor becoming less responsive when the current source has a large number of foldable regions.

_84.description: Controls whether clicking on the empty content after a folded line will unfold the line.

anyOf.description: Enables/Disables font ligatures ('calt' and 'liga' font features). Change this to a string for fine-grained control of the 'font-feature-settings' CSS property.
Explicit 'font-feature-settings' CSS property. A boolean can be passed instead if one only needs to turn on/off ligatures.

_86.description: Configures font ligatures or font features. Can be either a boolean to enable/disable ligatures or a string for the value of the CSS 'font-feature-settings' property.

_87.description: Controls the font size in pixels.

_88.description: Controls the font weight. Accepts "normal" and "bold" keywords or numbers between 1 and 1000.

anyOf.description: Enables/Disables the translation from font-weight to font-variation-settings. Change this to a string for fine-grained control of the 'font-variation-settings' CSS property.
Explicit 'font-variation-settings' CSS property. A boolean can be passed instead if one only needs to translate font-weight to font-variation-settings.

_89.description: Configures font variations. Can be either a boolean to enable/disable the translation from font-weight to font-variation-settings or a string for the value of the CSS 'font-variation-settings' property.

_90.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically format the pasted content. A formatter must be available and the formatter should be able to format a range in a document.

_91.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically format the line after typing.

_92.description: Controls whether the editor should render the vertical glyph margin. Glyph margin is mostly used for debugging.

_93.deprecationMessage: This setting is deprecated, please use separate settings like 'editor.editor.gotoLocation.multipleDefinitions' or 'editor.editor.gotoLocation.multipleImplementations' instead.

_94.description: Controls the behavior the 'Go to Definition'-command when multiple target locations exist.
enumDescriptions: Show Peek view of the results (default)
Go to the primary result and show a Peek view
Go to the primary result and enable Peek-less navigation to others

_95.description: Controls the behavior the 'Go to Type Definition'-command when multiple target locations exist.
enumDescriptions: Show Peek view of the results (default)
Go to the primary result and show a Peek view
Go to the primary result and enable Peek-less navigation to others

_96.description: Controls the behavior the 'Go to Declaration'-command when multiple target locations exist.
enumDescriptions: Show Peek view of the results (default)
Go to the primary result and show a Peek view
Go to the primary result and enable Peek-less navigation to others

_97.description: Controls the behavior the 'Go to Implementations'-command when multiple target locations exist.
enumDescriptions: Show Peek view of the results (default)
Go to the primary result and show a Peek view
Go to the primary result and enable Peek-less navigation to others

_98.description: Controls the behavior the 'Go to References'-command when multiple target locations exist.
enumDescriptions: Show Peek view of the results (default)
Go to the primary result and show a Peek view
Go to the primary result and enable Peek-less navigation to others

_99.description: Alternative command id that is being executed when the result of 'Go to Definition' is the current location.

_100.description: Alternative command id that is being executed when the result of 'Go to Type Definition' is the current location.

_101.description: Alternative command id that is being executed when the result of 'Go to Declaration' is the current location.

_102.description: Alternative command id that is being executed when the result of 'Go to Implementation' is the current location.

_103.description: Alternative command id that is being executed when the result of 'Go to Reference' is the current location.

_104.description: Controls whether the cursor should be hidden in the overview ruler.

_105.description: Controls whether the hover is shown.

_106.description: Controls the delay in milliseconds after which the hover is shown.

_107.description: Controls whether the hover should remain visible when mouse is moved over it.

_108.description: Controls the delay in milliseconds after which the hover is hidden. Requires `editor.hover.sticky` to be enabled.

_109.description: Prefer showing hovers above the line, if there's space.

_110.description: Controls whether to automatically show inline suggestions in the editor.

enumDescriptions: Show the inline suggestion toolbar whenever an inline suggestion is shown.
Show the inline suggestion toolbar when hovering over an inline suggestion.
Never show the inline suggestion toolbar.
_111.description: Controls when to show the inline suggestion toolbar.

_112.description: Controls whether to show syntax highlighting for inline suggestions in the editor.

_113.description: Controls how inline suggestions interact with the suggest widget. If enabled, the suggest widget is not shown automatically when inline suggestions are available.

_114.description: Suppresses inline completions for specified extension IDs -- comma separated.

_115.description: Controls whether to trigger a command when the inline suggestion provider changes.

_116.description: Controls the font family of the inline suggestions.

_117.description: Controls whether showing a suggestion will shift the code to make space for the suggestion inline.

_118.description: Controls whether larger suggestions can be shown side by side.
enumDescriptions: Larger suggestions will show side by side if there is enough space, otherwise they will be shown below.
Larger suggestions are never shown side by side and will always be shown below.

_119.description: Controls whether the suggestion will show as collapsed until jumping to it.

_120.description: Controls the letter spacing in pixels.

enumDescriptions: Disable the code action menu.
Show the code action menu when the cursor is on lines with code.
Show the code action menu when the cursor is on lines with code or on empty lines.
_121.description: Enables the Code Action lightbulb in the editor.

_122.markdownDescription:
Controls the line height. 
 - Use 0 to automatically compute the line height from the font size.
 - Values between 0 and 8 will be used as a multiplier with the font size.
 - Values greater than or equal to 8 will be used as effective values.

enumDescriptions: Line numbers are not rendered.
Line numbers are rendered as absolute number.
Line numbers are rendered as distance in lines to cursor position.
Line numbers are rendered every 10 lines.
_123.description: Controls the display of line numbers.

_124.description: Controls whether the editor has linked editing enabled. Depending on the language, related symbols such as HTML tags, are updated while editing.

_125.description: Controls whether the editor should detect links and make them clickable.

_127.description: Controls whether the minimap is shown.

enumDescriptions: The minimap is always shown.
The minimap is hidden when mouse is not over the minimap and shown when mouse is over the minimap.
The minimap is only shown when the editor is scrolled
_128.description: Controls whether the minimap is hidden automatically.

enumDescriptions: The minimap has the same size as the editor contents (and might scroll).
The minimap will stretch or shrink as necessary to fill the height of the editor (no scrolling).
The minimap will shrink as necessary to never be larger than the editor (no scrolling).
_129.description: Controls the size of the minimap.

_130.description: Controls the side where to render the minimap.

_131.description: Controls when the minimap slider is shown.

_132.description: Scale of content drawn in the minimap: 1, 2 or 3.

_133.description: Render the actual characters on a line as opposed to color blocks.

_134.description: Limit the width of the minimap to render at most a certain number of columns.

_135.description: Controls whether named regions are shown as section headers in the minimap.

_136.description: Controls whether MARK: comments are shown as section headers in the minimap.

_137.description: Defines the regular expression used to find section headers in comments. The regex must contain a named match group `label` (written as `(?<label>.+)`) that encapsulates the section header, otherwise it will not work. Optionally you can include another match group named `separator`. Use \n in the pattern to match multi-line headers.

_138.description: Controls the font size of section headers in the minimap.

_139.description: Controls the amount of space (in pixels) between characters of section header. This helps the readability of the header in small font sizes.

_140.markdownDescription: A multiplier to be used on the `deltaX` and `deltaY` of mouse wheel scroll events.

_141.markdownDescription: Zoom the font of the editor when using mouse wheel and holding `Ctrl`.

_142.description: Merge multiple cursors when they are overlapping.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Maps to `Control` on Windows and Linux and to `Command` on macOS.
Maps to `Alt` on Windows and Linux and to `Option` on macOS.
_143.markdownDescription: The modifier to be used to add multiple cursors with the mouse. The Go to Definition and Open Link mouse gestures will adapt such that they do not conflict with the [multicursor modifier](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/codebasics#_multicursor-modifier).

markdownEnumDescriptions: Each cursor pastes a single line of the text.
Each cursor pastes the full text.
_144.markdownDescription: Controls pasting when the line count of the pasted text matches the cursor count.

_145.markdownDescription: Controls the max number of cursors that can be in an active editor at once.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Highlights occurrences only in the current file.
Experimental: Highlights occurrences across all valid open files.
_146.markdownDescription: Controls whether occurrences should be highlighted across open files.

_147.description: Controls the delay in milliseconds after which occurrences are highlighted.

_148.description: Controls the cursor style in overtype input mode.

_150.description: Controls whether a border should be drawn around the overview ruler.

_151.description: Controls the amount of space between the top edge of the editor and the first line.

_152.description: Controls the amount of space between the bottom edge of the editor and the last line.

_153.markdownDescription: Controls whether you can paste content in different ways.

_154.markdownDescription: Controls if a widget is shown when pasting content in to the editor. This widget lets you control how the file is pasted.
enumDescriptions: Show the paste selector widget after content is pasted into the editor.
Never show the paste selector widget. Instead the default pasting behavior is always used.

_155.description: Enables a pop-up that shows parameter documentation and type information as you type.

_156.description: Controls whether the parameter hints menu cycles or closes when reaching the end of the list.

enumDescriptions: Focus the tree when opening peek
Focus the editor when opening peek
_157.description: Controls whether to focus the inline editor or the tree in the peek widget.

_158.description: Controls whether the Go to Definition mouse gesture always opens the peek widget.

other.description: Enable quick suggestions outside of strings and comments.

_159.markdownDescription: Controls whether suggestions should automatically show up while typing. This can be controlled for typing in comments, strings, and other code. Quick suggestion can be configured to show as ghost text or with the suggest widget. Also be aware of the `#editor.suggestOnTriggerCharacters#`-setting which controls if suggestions are triggered by special characters.

_160.description: Controls the delay in milliseconds after which quick suggestions will show up.

_161.description: Controls whether the editor auto renames on type.

_162.description: Whether to render rich screen reader content when the `editor.editContext` is enabled.

_163.description: Controls whether the editor should render control characters.

_164.description: Render last line number when the file ends with a newline.

enumDescriptions: Highlights both the gutter and the current line.
_165.description: Controls how the editor should render the current line highlight.

_166.description: Controls if the editor should render the current line highlight only when the editor is focused.

enumDescriptions: Render whitespace characters except for single spaces between words.
Render whitespace characters only on selected text.
Render only trailing whitespace characters.
_167.description: Controls how the editor should render whitespace characters.

_168.description: Controls whether selections should have rounded corners.

_169.description: Render vertical rulers after a certain number of monospace characters. Use multiple values for multiple rulers. No rulers are drawn if array is empty.

enumDescriptions: The vertical scrollbar will be visible only when necessary.
The vertical scrollbar will always be visible.
The vertical scrollbar will always be hidden.
_170.description: Controls the visibility of the vertical scrollbar.

enumDescriptions: The horizontal scrollbar will be visible only when necessary.
The horizontal scrollbar will always be visible.
The horizontal scrollbar will always be hidden.
_171.description: Controls the visibility of the horizontal scrollbar.

_172.description: The width of the vertical scrollbar.

_173.description: The height of the horizontal scrollbar.

_174.description: Controls whether clicks scroll by page or jump to click position.

_175.description: When set, the horizontal scrollbar will not increase the size of the editor's content.

_176.description: Controls the number of extra characters beyond which the editor will scroll horizontally.

_177.description: Controls whether the editor will scroll beyond the last line.

_178.description: Scroll only along the predominant axis when scrolling both vertically and horizontally at the same time. Prevents horizontal drift when scrolling vertically on a trackpad.

_179.description: Controls whether the Linux primary clipboard should be supported.

_180.description: Controls whether the editor should highlight matches similar to the selection.

_181.description: Controls how many characters can be in the selection before similiar matches are not highlighted. Set to zero for unlimited.

_182.description: Controls whether the editor should highlight selection matches that span multiple lines.

enumDescriptions: Always show the folding controls.
Never show the folding controls and reduce the gutter size.
Only show the folding controls when the mouse is over the gutter.
_183.description: Controls when the folding controls on the gutter are shown.

_184.description: Controls fading out of unused code.

enumDescriptions: Show snippet suggestions on top of other suggestions.
Show snippet suggestions below other suggestions.
Show snippets suggestions with other suggestions.
Do not show snippet suggestions.
_185.description: Controls whether snippets are shown with other suggestions and how they are sorted.

_186.description: Whether leading and trailing whitespace should always be selected.

_187.description: Whether subwords (like 'foo' in 'fooBar' or 'foo_bar') should be selected.

_188.description: Controls whether the editor will scroll using an animation.

_189.description: Shows the nested current scopes during the scroll at the top of the editor.

_190.description: Defines the maximum number of sticky lines to show.

_191.description: Defines the model to use for determining which lines to stick. If the outline model does not exist, it will fall back on the folding provider model which falls back on the indentation model. This order is respected in all three cases.

_192.description: Enable scrolling of Sticky Scroll with the editor's horizontal scrollbar.

_193.description: Emulate selection behavior of tab characters when using spaces for indentation. Selection will stick to tab stops.

enumDescriptions: Insert suggestion without overwriting text right of the cursor.
Insert suggestion and overwrite text right of the cursor.
_194.description: Controls whether words are overwritten when accepting completions. Note that this depends on extensions opting into this feature.

_195.description: Controls whether filtering and sorting suggestions accounts for small typos.

_196.description: Controls whether sorting favors words that appear close to the cursor.

_197.markdownDescription: Controls whether remembered suggestion selections are shared between multiple workspaces and windows (needs `#editor.suggestSelection#`).

enumDescriptions: Always select a suggestion when automatically triggering IntelliSense.
Never select a suggestion when automatically triggering IntelliSense.
Select a suggestion only when triggering IntelliSense from a trigger character.
Select a suggestion only when triggering IntelliSense as you type.
_198.markdownDescription: Controls whether a suggestion is selected when the widget shows. Note that this only applies to automatically triggered suggestions (`#editor.quickSuggestions#` and `#editor.suggestOnTriggerCharacters#`) and that a suggestion is always selected when explicitly invoked, e.g via `Ctrl+Space`.

_199.description: Controls whether an active snippet prevents quick suggestions.

_200.description: Controls whether to show or hide icons in suggestions.

_201.description: Controls the visibility of the status bar at the bottom of the suggest widget.

_202.description: Controls whether to preview the suggestion outcome in the editor.

_203.description: Controls whether suggest details show inline with the label or only in the details widget.

_204.deprecationMessage: This setting is deprecated. The suggest widget can now be resized.

_205.deprecationMessage: This setting is deprecated, please use separate settings like 'editor.suggest.showKeywords' or 'editor.suggest.showSnippets' instead.

_210.markdownDescription: When enabled IntelliSense filtering requires that the first character matches on a word start. For example, `c` on `Console` or `WebContext` but _not_ on `description`. When disabled IntelliSense will show more results but still sorts them by match quality.

_236.markdownDescription: Font size for the suggest widget. When set to `0`, the value of `#editor.fontSize#` is used.

_237.markdownDescription: Line height for the suggest widget. When set to `0`, the value of `#editor.lineHeight#` is used. The minimum value is 8.

_238.description: Controls whether suggestions should automatically show up when typing trigger characters.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Select recent suggestions unless further typing selects one, e.g. `console.| -> console.log` because `log` has been completed recently.
Select suggestions based on previous prefixes that have completed those suggestions, e.g. `co -> console` and `con -> const`.
_239.description: Controls how suggestions are pre-selected when showing the suggest list.

enumDescriptions: Tab complete will insert the best matching suggestion when pressing tab.
Disable tab completions.
Tab complete snippets when their prefix match. Works best when 'quickSuggestions' aren't enabled.

_241.description: Controls whether the editor will also delete the next line's indentation whitespace when deleting a newline.

_242.description: Controls whether all non-basic ASCII characters are highlighted. Only characters between U+0020 and U+007E, tab, line-feed and carriage-return are considered basic ASCII.

_243.description: Controls whether characters that just reserve space or have no width at all are highlighted.

_244.description: Controls whether characters are highlighted that can be confused with basic ASCII characters, except those that are common in the current user locale.

_245.description: Controls whether characters in comments should also be subject to Unicode highlighting.

_246.description: Controls whether characters in strings should also be subject to Unicode highlighting.

_247.description: Defines allowed characters that are not being highlighted.

_248.description: Unicode characters that are common in allowed locales are not being highlighted.

enumDescriptions: Unusual line terminators are automatically removed.
Unusual line terminators are ignored.
Unusual line terminators prompt to be removed.
_249.description: Remove unusual line terminators that might cause problems.

_250.description: Spaces and tabs are inserted and deleted in alignment with tab stops.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Use the default line break rule.
Word breaks should not be used for Chinese/Japanese/Korean (CJK) text. Non-CJK text behavior is the same as for normal.
_251.description: Controls the word break rules used for Chinese/Japanese/Korean (CJK) text.

_252.description: Locales to be used for word segmentation when doing word related navigations or operations. Specify the BCP 47 language tag of the word you wish to recognize (e.g., ja, zh-CN, zh-Hant-TW, etc.).

_253.description: Characters that will be used as word separators when doing word related navigations or operations.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Lines will wrap at the viewport width.
Lines will wrap at the minimum of viewport and `#editor.wordWrapColumn#`.

_255.markdownDescription: Controls the wrapping column of the editor when `#editor.wordWrap#` is `wordWrapColumn` or `bounded`.

enumDescriptions: No indentation. Wrapped lines begin at column 1.
Wrapped lines get the same indentation as the parent.
Wrapped lines get +1 indentation toward the parent.
Wrapped lines get +2 indentation toward the parent.
_256.description: Controls the indentation of wrapped lines.

enumDescriptions: Assumes that all characters are of the same width. This is a fast algorithm that works correctly for monospace fonts and certain scripts (like Latin characters) where glyphs are of equal width.
Delegates wrapping points computation to the browser. This is a slow algorithm, that might cause freezes for large files, but it works correctly in all cases.
_257.description: Controls the algorithm that computes wrapping points. Note that when in accessibility mode, advanced will be used for the best experience.

_259.description: Make scrolling inertial - mostly useful with touchpad on linux.

_260.description: Enables the inlay hints in the editor.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Inlay hints are showing by default and hide when holding Ctrl+Alt
Inlay hints are hidden by default and show when holding Ctrl+Alt

_261.markdownDescription: Controls font size of inlay hints in the editor. As default the `#editor.fontSize#` is used when the configured value is less than `5` or greater than the editor font size.

_262.markdownDescription: Controls font family of inlay hints in the editor. When set to empty, the `#editor.fontFamily#` is used.

_263.description: Enables the padding around the inlay hints in the editor.

_264.markdownDescription: Maximum overall length of inlay hints, for a single line, before they get truncated by the editor. Set to `0` to never truncate

_265.markdownDescription:
Controls whether literal `\n` shall trigger a wordWrap when `#editor.wordWrap#` is enabled.

For example:
```c
char* str="hello\nworld"
```
will be displayed as
```c
char* str="hello\n
           world"
```

_266.markdownDescription: Controls whether the editor receives tabs or defers them to the workbench for navigation.

enumDescriptions: Show default color decorators only when no extension provides colors decorators.
Always show default color decorators.
Never show default color decorators.
_267.description: Controls whether inline color decorations should be shown using the default document color provider.

enumDescriptions: Make the color picker appear both on click and hover of the color decorator
Make the color picker appear on hover of the color decorator
Make the color picker appear on click of the color decorator
_268.description: Controls the condition to make a color picker appear from a color decorator.

_269.description: Controls whether the accessibility hint should be provided to screen reader users when an inline completion is shown.

_270.description: Controls whether the editor will scroll when the middle button is pressed.

_272.description: The glob pattern to match file paths against. Set to true or false to enable or disable the pattern.

path.description: A single path to a shell executable.

_274.description: An optional set of arguments to run the shell executable with.

_275.description: Whether or not to replace the dynamic terminal title that detects what program is running with the static profile name.

_276.description: A codicon ID to associate with the terminal icon.

_277.description: A theme color ID to associate with the terminal icon.

_278.markdownDescription: An object with environment variables that will be added to the terminal profile process. Set to `null` to delete environment variables from the base environment.

extensionIdentifier.description: The extension that contributed this profile.

id.description: The id of the extension terminal

title.description: The name of the extension terminal

path.description: A single path to a shell executable or an array of paths that will be used as fallbacks when one fails.

_283.errorMessage: Only "normal" and "bold" keywords or numbers between 1 and 1000 are allowed.

enumDescriptions: Automatically approve the pattern.
Require explicit approval for the pattern.
_286.description: The start of a command to match against. A regular expression can be provided by wrapping the string in `/` characters.

enumDescriptions: UI extension kind. In a remote window, such extensions are enabled only when available on the local machine.
Workspace extension kind. In a remote window, such extensions are enabled only when available on the remote.

_289.description: Automatically prompt for elevation (if needed) when this port is forwarded. Elevate is required if the local port is a privileged port.

_290.description: Label that will be shown in the UI for this port.

_291.markdownDescription: When true, a modal dialog will show if the chosen local port isn't used for forwarding.

_292.description: The protocol to use when forwarding this port.

_293.description: A list of minimatch patterns for locations (folders and URLs) in which source maps can be used to resolve local files. This can be used to avoid incorrectly breaking in external source mapped code. Patterns can be prefixed with "!" to exclude them. May be set to an empty array or null to avoid restriction.

_294.description: If source maps are enabled, these glob patterns specify the generated JavaScript files. If a pattern starts with `!` the files are excluded. If not specified, the generated code is expected in the same directory as its source.

_295.markdownDescription: Whether to wait for source maps to load for each incoming script. This has a performance overhead, and might be safely disabled when running off of disk, so long as `rootPath` is not disabled.

_296.description: Show the async calls that led to the current call stack.

_297.description: An array of file or folder names, or path globs, to skip when debugging. Star patterns and negations are allowed, for example, `["**/node_modules/**", "!**/node_modules/my-module/**"]`

_298.description: Automatically step through generated code that cannot be mapped back to the original source.

_299.description: Use JavaScript source maps (if they exist).

_300.description: Whether to use the "names" mapping in sourcemaps. This requires requesting source content, which can be slow with certain debuggers.

_301.description: A set of mappings for rewriting the locations of source files from what the sourcemap says, to their locations on disk.

_302.description: Retry for this number of milliseconds to connect to Node.js. Default is 10000 ms.

sourceMapMinPause.description: Minimum time in milliseconds spent waiting for each source-map to be processed when a script is being parsed

sourceMapCumulativePause.description: Extra time in milliseconds allowed per session to be spent waiting for source-maps to be processed, after the minimum time (sourceMapMinPause) has been exhausted

hoverEvaluation.description: Time until value evaluation for hovered symbols is aborted. If set to 0, hover evaluation does never time out.

_304.description: Configures what diagnostic output is produced.

oneOf.description: Trace may be set to 'true' to write diagnostic logs to the disk.

stdio.description: Whether to return trace data from the launched application or browser.

logFile.description: Configures where on disk logs are written.

_305.markdownDescription: From where to capture output messages: the default debug API if set to `console`, or stdout/stderr streams if set to `std`.

_306.description: Toggles whether we verify the contents of files on disk match the ones loaded in the runtime. This is useful in a variety of scenarios and required in some, but can cause issues if you have server-side transformation of scripts, for example.

_307.description:
Customize the textual description the debugger shows for objects (local variables, etc...). Samples:
      1. this.toString() // will call toString to print all objects
      2. this.customDescription ? this.customDescription() : defaultValue // Use customDescription method if available, if not return defaultValue
      3. function (def) { return this.customDescription ? this.customDescription() : def } // Use customDescription method if available, if not return defaultValue

_308.description:
Customize the properties shown for an object in the debugger (local variables, etc...). Samples:
    1. { ...this, extraProperty: '12345' } // Add an extraProperty 12345 to all objects
    2. this.customProperties ? this.customProperties() : this // Use customProperties method if available, if not use the properties in this (the default properties)
    3. function () { return this.customProperties ? this.customProperties() : this } // Use customDescription method if available, if not return the default properties

    Deprecated: This is a temporary implementation of this feature until we have time to implement it in the way described here: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/102181

_309.description: A list of debug sessions which, when this debug session is terminated, will also be stopped.

_310.markdownDescription: Toggles whether the debugger will try to read DWARF debug symbols from WebAssembly, which can be resource intensive. Requires the `ms-vscode.wasm-dwarf-debugging` extension to function.

_311.description: Absolute path to the working directory of the program being debugged. If you've set localRoot then cwd will match that value otherwise it falls back to your workspaceFolder

_312.description: Path to the local directory containing the program.

_313.description: Absolute path to the remote directory containing the program.

_314.description: Attach debugger to new child processes automatically.

_315.markdownDescription: Environment variables passed to the program. The value `null` removes the variable from the environment.

_316.description: Absolute path to a file containing environment variable definitions.

_317.markdownDescription: A list of patterns at which to manually insert entrypoint breakpoints. This can be useful to give the debugger an opportunity to set breakpoints when using sourcemaps that don't exist or can't be detected before launch, such as [with the Serverless framework](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-js-debug/issues/492).

_318.description: Allows you to explicitly specify the Node version that's running, which can be used to disable or enable certain behaviors in cases where the automatic version detection does not work.

_319.description: Command to run in the launched terminal. If not provided, the terminal will open without launching a program.

_321.description: Try to reconnect to the program if we lose connection. If set to `true`, we'll try once a second, forever. You can customize the interval and maximum number of attempts by specifying the `delay` and `maxAttempts` in an object instead.

_323.description: Makes `Go to Definition` avoid type declaration files when possible by triggering `Go to Source Definition` instead. This allows `Go to Source Definition` to be triggered with the mouse gesture.

_324.markdownDescription: Automatically update imports when pasting code. Requires TypeScript 5.6+.

_325.markdownDescription: Advanced preferences that control how imports are ordered.

caseSensitivity.markdownDescription: Specifies how imports should be sorted with regards to case-sensitivity. If `auto` or unspecified, we will detect the case-sensitivity per file

typeOrder.markdownDescription: Specify how type-only named imports should be sorted.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Detect where type-only named imports should be sorted.
Type only named imports are sorted to the end of the import list. E.g. `import { B, Z, type A, type Y } from 'module';`
Named imports are sorted by name only. E.g. `import { type A, B, type Y, Z } from 'module';`
Type only named imports are sorted to the beginning of the import list. E.g. `import { type A, type Y, B, Z } from 'module';`

unicodeCollation.markdownDescription: Specify whether to sort imports using Unicode or Ordinal collation.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Sort imports using the numeric value of each code point.
Sort imports using the Unicode code collation.

locale.markdownDescription: Requires `organizeImports.unicodeCollation: 'unicode'`. Overrides the locale used for collation. Specify `auto` to use the UI locale.

numericCollation.markdownDescription: Requires `organizeImports.unicodeCollation: 'unicode'`. Sort numeric strings by integer value.

accentCollation.markdownDescription: Requires `organizeImports.unicodeCollation: 'unicode'`. Compare characters with diacritical marks as unequal to base character.

caseFirst.markdownDescription: Requires `organizeImports.unicodeCollation: 'unicode'`, and `organizeImports.caseSensitivity` is not `caseInsensitive`. Indicates whether upper-case will sort before lower-case.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Upper-case comes before lower-case. E.g. ` A, a, B, b`.
Lower-case comes before upper-case. E.g.` a, A, z, Z`.

items.description: The opening bracket character or string sequence.
The closing bracket character or string sequence.

when.markdownDescription: Additional check on the siblings of a matching file. Use \$(basename) as variable for the matching file name.

_330.description: Plays a sound when the active line has a warning.
enumDescriptions: Enable sound when a screen reader is attached.
Enable sound.
Disable sound.

_331.description: Plays a signal - sound (audio cue) and/or announcement (alert) - when the active line has a warning.

announcement.description: Announces when the active line has a warning.
enumDescriptions: Enable announcement, will only play when in screen reader optimized mode.
Disable announcement.

_332.description: By default, VS Code triggers property value completion after selecting a CSS property. Use this setting to disable this behavior.

_333.description: Insert semicolon at end of line when completing CSS properties.

_335.description: When using a vendor-specific prefix make sure to also include all other vendor-specific properties.

_336.description: When using a vendor-specific prefix, also include the standard property.

_337.description: Do not use duplicate style definitions.

_350.markdownDescription: Property is ignored due to the display. E.g. with `display: inline`, the `width`, `height`, `margin-top`, `margin-bottom`, and `float` properties have no effect.

_351.markdownDescription: Avoid using `!important`. It is an indication that the specificity of the entire CSS has gotten out of control and needs to be refactored.

_352.markdownDescription: Avoid using `float`. Floats lead to fragile CSS that is easy to break if one aspect of the layout changes.

_353.description: Selectors should not contain IDs because these rules are too tightly coupled with the HTML.

_356.markdownDescription: Separate rulesets by a blank line.

_358.markdownDescription: Put braces on the same line as rules (`collapse`) or put braces on own line (`expand`).

_374.markdownDescription: Specify glob patterns of files to exclude from auto imports. Relative paths are resolved relative to the workspace root. Patterns are evaluated using tsconfig.json [`exclude`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#exclude) semantics.

_375.markdownDescription:
Specify regular expressions to exclude auto imports with matching import specifiers. Examples:

- `^node:`
- `lib/internal` (slashes don't need to be escaped...)
- `/lib\/internal/i` (...unless including surrounding slashes for `i` or `u` flags)
- `^lodash$` (only allow subpath imports from lodash)
